comments.content:
I like your list and agree. But for me (9+ years UCS admin) I am going to say FC Storage Port and Storage connectivity policy. 

There is a default VSAN 1 that can be utilized, given you don't have other arrays or FC Uplinks using VSAN 1, otherwise you would have to create a new VSAN and correlate to the desired array so the vHBAs can pin to the correct uplink. Not necessarily a 'must' 

You definitely MUST configure a Storage FC interface for Directly attach array and must zone the array for them to communicate with the storage connectivity policy. 

You never know whoever wrote this what they read in a document and what answer they are looking for and how expert they are in EVERY technology on this exam. They may have deep level on some, but surely only going to have surface depth on others. Annoying these questions and answers are, especially when some are very subjective.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Configure Direct Attached Storage
The general process to configure DAS in UCS is:
1. Configure FI in FC switch mode.
2. Create required virtual SAN (VSAN). <<<< 
3. Set the port role in UCS.
4. Check if the storage port worldwide port name (WWPN) is logged in to the fabric.
and then
Configure FC Zoning
The general process to configure the server is:
1. Create storage connection policy. <<<
2. Create a service profile.
3. Associate the service profile with the server.

From my understanding you need to do all 7 steps (4+3) for DAS implementation hence I'm voting for D & E

Selected Answer: BD
I agree with CoAsT_x ... so I pick B and D

Selected Answer: BE
As per already provided documentation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
a & b are correct

questions.answer_description:
Verifying a Session -
To verify a session, use the following command in session mode.


Committing a Session -
To commit a session, use the following command in session mode.

Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/configuration/guide/cli/CLIConfigurationGuide/sm_rollback.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. All users logged in to the UCSM are logged out, and their sessions end.


During the direct upgrade of Cisco UCS Manager firmware, it is expected that all users who are logged into UCS Manager (UCSM) will be logged out and their sessions will end. This occurs because the UCS Manager itself is being upgraded, which requires a reboot of the system, leading to the termination of active management sessions.

Selected Answer: D
D s correct

Selected Answer: D
it will be D

Selected Answer: D
According to cisco:
Outage Impacts of Direct Firmware Upgrades
A firmware upgrade to Cisco UCS Manager causes the following disruptions:

Cisco UCS Manager GUI—All users logged in to Cisco UCS Manager GUI are logged out and their sessions ended.
Any unsaved work in progress is lost.
Cisco UCS Manager CLI—All users logged in through telnet are logged out and their sessions ended.

questions.question_text: Which event is expected during direct upgrade of Cisco UCS Manager firmware?

choices.D: All users logged in to the UCSM are logged out, and their sessions end.
choices.B: Data traffic is disrupted for a single fabric interconnect setup.
choices.A: The I/O Module reboots immediately after the firmware is activated.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Cisco Doc: 
Step 1 Configure the server ports on the FI.
Step 2 Disconnect the cables from the FEX and connect them to the configured server ports on Fabric Interconnect.
Step 3 On the Cisco UCS Manager GUI, right click the server, from the pop-up menu, select Recover Server or Server Maintenance.
Step 4 Click Re-acknowledge and select OK.
This will cause server reboot.

Selected Answer: A
A is the one

comments.content: I was wrong A seems fine is the connection mode what was changed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It should be C the server was on standalone so a reack is not posible

questions.question_text: An engineer must migrate a Cisco UCS C-Series server from Cisco SingleConnect to direct connect integration mode. The Cisco UCS Manager Rack Server Discovery Policy and Rack Management Connection Policy are set to Immediate and Auto-Acknowledge. Which set of steps accomplishes this task?

choices.A:
Disconnect the cables from the FEX.
Connect the cables to server ports on the fabric interconnect.
Reacknowledge the server.
choices.D:
Disconnect the cables from the FEX.
Connect the cables to appliance ports on the fabric interconnect.
Reset the Cisco IMC of the server.
choices.C:
Disconnect the cables from the FEX.
Connect the cables to server ports on the fabric interconnect.
Reset the Cisco IMC of the server.
choices.B:
Disconnect the cables from the FEX.
Connect the cables to appliance ports on the fabric interconnect.
Reacknowledge the server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct and also D but higher cost is not always a benefit.
